archetype_name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
name: Lemongrass-Lime Chicken & Veggie Rice Soup (No Soy)
description: Light, brothy chicken soup with lemongrass, bok choy, carrots, and jasmine rice. Bright lime finishes a fresh Japanese/Vietnamese-inspired weeknight bowl.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 cup jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Peel and finely chop 2 cloves garlic.
Trim and slice 2 bok choy (separate stems and leaves).
Thinly slice 500 g chicken thighs (trim excess fat).
If using lemongrass, trim and bruise 1 stalk; if using lemongrass paste, measure 1 tablespoon.
cook_steps: Add 1 cup jasmine rice and 1.5 cups water to a pot; bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender. Keep warm.
Heat 1 tablespoon canola oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic; cook 2–3 minutes until fragrant.
Add chicken thighs; season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and a pinch of black pepper. Cook 3–4 minutes until lightly opaque.
Stir in 1 tablespoon lemongrass paste (or the bruised stalk).
Pour in 4 cups chicken stock and 2 cups water; bring to a gentle boil.
Add carrots and mushrooms; simmer 8–10 minutes until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Add bok choy stems; cook 2 minutes, then add bok choy leaves and cook 1 minute more.
Turn off heat. Squeeze 2 lime wedges into the pot, taste, and adjust with salt and black pepper.
To serve, add a scoop of rice to each bowl, ladle soup over, and garnish with spring onion. Serve with extra lime wedges.
instructions: Rinse 1 cup jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Peel and finely chop 2 cloves garlic.
Halve and thinly slice 1 onion.
Slice 2 carrots into thin rounds.
Trim and slice 2 bok choy (separate stems and leaves).
Wipe and slice 1 cup mushrooms.
Thinly slice 500 g chicken thighs (trim excess fat).
Cut 1 lime into wedges.
If using lemongrass, trim and bruise 1 stalk; if using lemongrass paste, measure 1 tablespoon.
Slice 2 spring onion for garnish.
Add 1 cup jasmine rice and 1.5 cups water to a pot; bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender. Keep warm.
Heat 1 tablespoon canola oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic; cook 2–3 minutes until fragrant.
Add chicken thighs; season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and a pinch of black pepper. Cook 3–4 minutes until lightly opaque.
Stir in 1 tablespoon lemongrass paste (or the bruised stalk).
Pour in 4 cups chicken stock and 2 cups water; bring to a gentle boil.
Add carrots and mushrooms; simmer 8–10 minutes until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Add bok choy stems; cook 2 minutes, then add bok choy leaves and cook 1 minute more.
Turn off heat. Squeeze 2 lime wedges into the pot, taste, and adjust with salt and black pepper.
To serve, add a scoop of rice to each bowl, ladle soup over, and garnish with spring onion. Serve with extra lime wedges.

ingredients.preparation: 1.5 cups for rice, 3 cups for soup

final_ingredients.preparation: 1.5 cups for rice, 3 cups for soup
